JD Vance positions himself as heir of the MAGA movement
subhead: The US vice president has made his mark in what is often a thankless role, railing against immigration, placing faith at the heart of his message and playing his part in diplomacy. He is seeking to make his candidacy for 2028 unavoidable – without upsetting Donald Trump.

title: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals, says Paris prosecutor

UK police release one of two men arrested over train stabbings and laud a 'heroic' rail worker
subhead: After arresting two British nationals, the police said later on Sunday that they considered only one of them, a 32-year-old man, as a suspect in the stabbing that wounded 10 people. They added that there is nothing to suggest a terrorist incident at this stage.

title: 'I never eat alone anymore': La Cop1ne, a Parisian community canteen offering a cure for loneliness
subhead: In Paris, the first solidarity canteen run by the Cop1 association opened its doors a year ago. Its mission: to combat food insecurity and social isolation among students.

title: Artificial intelligence is sparking a sexual revolution
subhead: Breakthroughs in AI sexology are happening at lightning speed, observes Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette, who nevertheless reminds us that other humans will always be our best allies in enriching our erotic lives.

title: China uses subsidies, coercion and propaganda to boost falling birth rates
subhead: After zealously enforcing the one-child policy, the city of Tianmen has made boosting the birth rate a top priority, as fertility continues to decline across China.

subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: All-you-can-eat buffets attract gourmet and value-conscious diners in France's city centers
subhead: Once mainly found near shopping centers, restaurants offering all-you-can-eat buffets, a model focusing on conviviality, comfort and an abundance of food, have started to open in Paris, Lyon and Bordeaux.

title: Water rises and land sinks in Vietnam's Mekong Delta
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (5/6) The Mekong Delta and Ho Chi Minh City, home to a third of Vietnam's population, face rising seas and the toll of decades of resource overuse, leaving much of the delta at risk of submersion.
